instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3536: What is 820-3536? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PM_SLP_S4_L: What is PM_SLP_S4_L? PM_SLP_S4_L is a signal that puts the system into an S4 suspend to disk sleep state when it is low(_L means signal is asserted when voltage is low).
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..
definitions.PM_PCH_PWROK: What is PM_PCH_PWROK? PM_PCH_PWROK is usually created by U1950, a 74LVC2G08GT chip and is necessary for the machine to wake from an S5 and S4 state and turn on. This signal will be present if ALL_SYS_PWRGD, CPU_VR_PGOOD, PP3V3_S0, and PP3V42_G3H are present. When this signal is not present or intermittent, usually pin 8 on U1950 for PP3V42_G3H is corroded..
definitions.U1950: What is U1950? This chip often becomes corroded on pin 8 on the PP3V42_G3H pin causing PM_SLP_S4_L to go missing.
definitions.U6100: What is U6100? this is an SPI ROM chip that holds the BIOS which is necessary for the machine to POST or try and power on..

threads.title: Macbook Pro Retina, <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> Signal.
threads.message:
Hi, i have a retina here. this mac gotten power on sometimes without backlight and sometimes no power, but always has green/orange light.

had corrosion on the mentioned parts 
<CAPACITOR>C1214</CAPACITOR> Has corrosion on the Pin one, miss the pad and i remove the older Cap and put from a identical donor the same cap. before replace it, i remove all the corrosion on the pad, put the cap on and run a jumper to Pin 1 of the <CAPACITOR>C1212</CAPACITOR>. 

Corrosion on <TRANSISTOR>Q7700</TRANSISTOR>. i replaced it with a same from identical board. and i fix some missing ways missing by the corrosion.

Corrosion on <RESISTOR>R5350</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R5351</RESISTOR>. The pads and the Resistors are ok, only resold and recover the pads.

Corrosion On <RESISTOR>R9753</RESISTOR>. i recover the pads and replaced the resistor.

Corrosi√≥n on <CAPACITOR>C7400</CAPACITOR>, i recover the pad and replace the cap.

So, thing is.. When i finish the fix, still not working. i tried some chargers and nothing. Gotten power on twice after the fix with working backlight and all ok, but when i put the board on the case doesn't work anymore. 
taking some measures, a lot of power rails are present, <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> are present. But!. no have any voltaje on the S4 State and S3.
Checking i realize actually does not have <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> signal

So, looking whole board this is not present in any part on the board. <SIGNAL>PM_PCH_PWROK</SIGNAL> Is not present.
i dont know what to do. 

Helpme plz

threads.title: Macbook Pro Retina, <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> Signal.
Macbook Pro Retina, <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> Signal.
threads.message:
For instant personal support contact me in DM for the $500 per day "personal support plan".

Probably corrosion on one of the common suspects, <CHIP>U1900</CHIP>, <CHIP>U1950</CHIP>, <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> and termination resistors in the data lines to <CHIP>U6100</CHIP>, corrosion under SMC.

threads.title: Macbook Pro Retina, <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> Signal.

threads.title: Macbook Pro Retina, <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> Signal.
threads.message: I suggest you check for corrosion on the parts I mentioned. But it can be corrosion anywhere. You saw where the corrosion was so those would be the first areas to inspect. So crap under <CHIP>U7400</CHIP> is likely too as <CAPACITOR>C7400</CAPACITOR> was fucked also inspect traces there.
